website_summaries.verdict: Versatile and inexpensive option from a leading name in grooming.
pros: Use for trimming, shaving, and edging
Includes two blades, three stubble combs, skin guard, and charger
cons: Lacks the power some may need in an electric razor

customer_reviews.title: NOT for your balls, and NOT for oriental people.
customer_reviews.text: I'm Chinese, AND I've used them on both my balls and my face. They're terrible for either purpose. For an oriental guy, I'd say my hair isn't even thick, but this razor is not even nearly strong enough to cut my facial hair. As for the pubes, it's not difficult to catch some of the very delicate skin in that general area in the business end of the razor. For me it's absolutely useless. This should be clearly stated in the product description: FOR WHITE FOLK ONLY, NOT FOR YOUR BALLS.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Liu

customer_reviews.title: Good? Yes. Revolutionary? Not in the slightest.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shaver. It shaves well, it's a neat form factor, it's small & light and would be ideal to carry if you travel a lot. But it's no better than any other electric shaver I've owned. No worse either. It's just another shaver. The idea that this is 'revolutionary new electric grooming technology' is pure marketing puff. I'd give it 5 stars for shaving perfectly well, but I'm taking one off for the excessive hype.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money for trimming both above and below the belt line.
customer_reviews.text: Great bit of kit. Really easy to edge your beard with these being as they’re quite a bit smaller than normal trimmers. The trim length guides are a bit flimsy, but I only tend to use the guards ‘down there’ for a bit of manscaping and they do the job, leaving my old chap cut-free. They hold their charge well and seem to last a decent amount of time between charges and they’re easy to use as a main razor as well, cutting closer than I thought they would after looking at other reviews. Overall, they’re worth the money and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin UK

customer_reviews.title: Blade has very short life..... The best electric shave I've had but not the fastest
customer_reviews.text: Having owned this shaver for a couple of months I realise that the blade is not man enough for regular shaving of an older guy. Deterioration was so rapid that I contacted Philips who replaced the blade. OK for a light, once a week type of user but no one else. ............ As an older person who now struggles to get a good shave with either rotary or foil electric razors this is a revelation. It is much slower going though so if all I need is a quick shave I use a rotary but if I want a good shave I use this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, the Philips OneBlade Hybrid is never going to outdo a traditional wet shave, but it cuts close enough for my purposes. Great for shaping beard and mustache. Haven't experienced any soreness or redness as some of the others mention, and this comes from someone who has always had a shaving rash after shaving normally. Charge lasts for ages, and it's small and light when travelling. Haven't used wet yet, as there didn't seem to be a need to. All in all a great piece of kit!
customer_reviews.author: P. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Weird charger
customer_reviews.text: Very good shaver. Comes with a very weird "EU charger" which does not fit to any of my EU electrical outlet ! Get a new one is 10€ and not even sure if it will fit...
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre

customer_reviews.title: Battery not up to standard
customer_reviews.text: Great item when it works. It worked fabulously for the first ten or so times I used it, I thought the battery was never going to need charged, it was marvellous. A perfect, not too close shave every time. Zero irritation. I thought I was laughing with this and decided to throw my old Braun shaver away. Unfortunately, since the first charge, the battery is just pathetic. I charged it the first time for a good few hours and was surprised when it cut out during only my second shave. It's just got worse since, so needless to say I am very disappointed and should have returned it earlier. You live and you learn...
customer_reviews.author: D. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: NOT A CLEAN SHAVE, but a close shave. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a quick shave. I misunderstood that it was a clean shaver, but it only cuts hair to a certain length, but now I have used it for a while, I really like it. I look clean shaven when using this product, and its only when my face is touched you feel stubble. Its really quick to shave with and the charge lasts ages.
customer_reviews.author: MR R VENTURA

customer_reviews.title: Not great if you want stubble
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for the Gillette ProStyler, that could be charged with the mains (as fed up of going through AA batteries). However, with this one you can either have a (relatively) clean shave, or a bit of a beard. I prefer a bit of stubble but unfortunately the lowest setting means me having quite an itchy beard. Removing the setting would mean a clean shave. Bit weird that they don't include a lower setting like the Gillette ProStyler does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blades disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure about this at first. Left long hairs on my neck that just would not get cut with this shaver. Having used this a few times I actually quite like this, but what I don't like is I have shaved 4 times and the blade has gone blunt already which with the RIP off price of the blade makes for an expensive shave. Not sure if the blade is faulty. Not sure to try purchasing another blade or return for refund. A friend also has this and seems ok with it,. I will update if I test another blade but at the moment not prepared to fork out for a new blade at further expense.
customer_reviews.author: The Way I See it

customer_reviews.title: Good but could end up being pricey
customer_reviews.text: I like this, it shaves reasonably close. Admittedly it is a very long time since I've used an electric shaver so they may just have gotten better. The blades are a bit pricey though and mine is already mostly green (meaning I should think about replacing the blade) after just a couple of weeks. Not sure how expensive it is going to be in the long run but this could be because I'm using it on both my face and my head.
customer_reviews.author: Spamvindaloo

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very excited about this device because it's not like any other device he bought / tried. The experience that this product offers you is exactly like in a men's hairdressing salon because it makes you so fine and soft that it is amazing that you can use this product at home.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I got this sometime ago, I really like it and the idea of it. I'm very sensitive and can't shave that often so I get quite a bit of stubble by the time I need a shave, but with this I can easy trim it down. I only gave 4 stars as I get patches that I find hard to trim (probably just my skin)
customer_reviews.author: Howard King

customer_reviews.title: Great stubble trimmer - for clean shaves not the best
customer_reviews.text: Great little stubble trimmer with a unique blade that ensures no cuts. If you plan to use it for a clean shave, its not the quickest which I originally brought this for...and leaves a big mess in the sink as throws the cut hair everywhere. I have returned to normal razer and shaving foam as it takes too long otherwise. Otherwise great for stubble and for tidying up around hairline and perfect if you have a meeting, want to shave but ensure you don’t cut yourself...just give yourself extra time. Would be perfect for teenagers as their first razor as is super safe.
customer_reviews.author: cybersec

customer_reviews.title: Great dry shave
customer_reviews.text: Great foamless shaver. Been using it routinely and you get a good shave however, it's not as close as a wet shave with your typical shaver. If you want a mental image of the shave it gives; think of it as if you shaved with a regular razor early in the morning and it's now the end of the work day. The plus side is that you can shave up or down or sideways and not need to wet your face or fear cuts or redness associated with sensitive skin (unless you go over the same spot lots of times)
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Ranta

customer_reviews.title: Really nice shaver
customer_reviews.text: Really good shaver. Doesn't pull hair, no cuts or irritation and it gets a very close shave. Battery life is good for several shaves however it would be nice if it had some sort of display for the battery life just in case it runs out mid shave... I also tried the 5mm guard and it works really well, where some other trimmers leave a patchy look where some hair isn't cut at all and some is cut shorter than the 5mm that the guard was supposed to do...
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: recommended.
customer_reviews.text: it will not do a "perfect" shave, but... it is the EASIEST and QUICKEST way to shave. it is not the ideal shaver for going in front of cameras, but it is good enough for everyday shave for normal office people. i have not seen any cuts to the face using the oneblade without the extra combs, but I do recommend attaching at least the smallest comb for underarm or genital area trimming. the size and weight makes it very portable. the combs are handy for beard trims and body hair trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Painful for Coarse Facial Hair
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this. I suffer from razor burn and pimples following shaving with anything but a brand new DE blade or safety razor, electrics have made me look like a teenager going through puberty I have so many spots afterwards. The claims on the Phillips One Blade were just what I needed and in a way it did deliver. The Positives: No razor burn or spots/pimples. The unit is a nicely designed item. Impossible to cut yourself. Waterproof The Negatives: No good for coarse facial hair as it pulls like mad and hurts on anything more than a few days growth. Replacement blades are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Tea Person

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant highly recommend for men or woman
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely swear by this shaver. I am a woman and struggle with razer burn as have sensitive skin so I have to use electric shavers. I have tried so many woman ones with no luck. This is amazing gets a extremely close shave without tugging or cutting. My 14 year old also has one and it gets into every little curve. This is my third one. I only got a new one as I lost my charger so now I have a spare. Battery lasts quite a long time too and blade only has to be replaced every 3/4 months and that's on a regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Zuzana Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great product, changed the world of shaving for me.
customer_reviews.text: This product is Amazing, a total game changer for shaving. It doesn’t get as close as a razor blade so if you don’t mind a tiny bit of rough(it really is minimal) then this is way better. No shaving foam/cream/gel, no cuts or nicks in the skin. The guards are great for a bit of manscaping (be careful without a guard though, somehow it can nick some skin!). The blade lasts for ages, I have a short beard but find this so much better than trimmers and it’s more durable. The battery lasts longer than I expected (well that or 45 mins of shaving is a heck of a long time).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had to be the worst razor/shaver I have ever used. The first time I used it, it cut all the hair off, but left a lot of stubble, which I had to catch using a manual BIC razor. The next week I used it, nothing came off, unless it was long hair, and required a charging as the battery started to die. I have returned this item, and gone to Costco to purchase some disposable razors. 32 for 25 - still under the cost of this.
customer_reviews.author: zarak

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this shaver
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical but the rave reviews convinced me to give it a try. I am glad I did because this is a remarkable trimmer/shaver. It's never going to give the truly close shave of a traditional razor blade, but this is made up for by how rapid you can get the job done with no need to use water/foam/gel (though you can if you wish and it gives a marginally closer shave) It's innovative and convenient, the blades last for months, there are additional attachments for beards etc. The charging is quick and long lasting too. I am just sorry I didn't buy one of these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Sans whiskers
customer_reviews.text: Great little bit of kit, used twice so far and still on the same charge, cuts nice and close, and I'm yet to draw blood using it, can't really comment on battery or blade life yet but it's a big thumbs up so far. Does seem a bit silly getting it delivered in a big cardboard box then selling a separate plastic case but I guess it's a money spinner for Phillips, haven't bought the case - lucky it comes with a cover to clip over the blade when not in use so i don't need a case, but if I was traveling all the time with it I would probably shell out on one.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Worse than an electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: I have one of those non branded electric shavers that only coats about £30.00, a few years ago. The one shave is worse than the electric shaver. It leaves uncut hair. Takes longer to shave, as I have to inspect my face closely. Was not expecting miracles, but only want to take one shaving device on my hols. Electric shaver wins. The only good part is that if you have longer stubble it deals with it with minimum fuss and is less painful than a wetshave when dealing with the stubble. Mind you, I have asian hair, which is very strong. - Wet shave great -Electric shave -OK -One blade- Not up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Samir Patel

customer_reviews.title: Easiest shave ever
customer_reviews.text: I have extra thick follicles and sensitive skin. Before this I was using a DE razor with very carefully chosen blades, real shaving soap, and a badger hair brush. Once I'd learned the technique for using them, that was much better than modern mulitblades and standard electrics - but this is much better again! It won't shave you completely smooth, but it will come acceptably close (ymmv.) The beard shaping ability is excellent. It's fast to use and leaves me with no irritation at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good, get the lithium!
customer_reviews.text: Very good shaver, have used it at least a dozen times before leaving feedback, obviously a bit sceptical, as there's so much tech for mowing your face out there, but it's good ,ive purchased a few good trimmer/ shavers, and it's my go to shaver, got the lithium one too, didn't realise this one was NIMH!, cuts the same, but prefer charging when I want, not at specific battery level, all in all, go for it, you'll be surprised!
customer_reviews.author: steviem3m5

customer_reviews.title: A great gadget
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what “sheerness” means so I ignore it! I have tried many different clippers/shears etc over the years but OneBlade is an innovation! Admittedly a conventional shave takes longer to achieve a close shave but other uses make it indispensable! Beard/Goatee trimming is a delight, precise trimming with blade only is so easy and the body guides are the best I have used. If you want your nether regions trimmed and clean, without nicks and cuts, buy this!! Battery life is fantastic too! Take the leap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery failed on previous purchase after 3 months and this after two months
customer_reviews.text: Nice shave but the blades at £8 a time only last a month. My previous model had a proper uk lead and the charging port on the base was different. I bought a second razer because the first failed (battery stopped charging) after 3 months and I have 5 blades to use up. A couple of months on this Oneblade also fails to charge ( I can get it to run for about 15 seconds.) I thought I could give the unused blades to my daughter's partner, but his Oneblade has also failed!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer yes!  Shaver no!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the good reviews I decided to try this, mainly to trim down my 3-day growth before shaving with a wet blade (as I have been doing up to now with my rotary shaver). As a shaver it cuts the hair on my face down to about a 1-day length, nowhere close to a real shave with a blade. It leaves big chunks of hair under my jaw and I can't use it at all on my neck it cuts me to shreds. But hey as a trimmer it works beautifully with the attachments if you want stubble, and with the body attachment it is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great shaver, make sure the item comes with a spare blade
customer_reviews.text: fantastic shaver, I am still using this now with no issues and very happy with the results. I do now and then use a wet shaver on top if I really want a close shave when going out on a night out. When I purchased this it did not come with an extra blade which was advertised and the seller wanted me to return it. I didnt feel comfortable doing so as he wouldnt be able to resell this item. So I contacted Amazon directly which as always were amazing and I was able to negotiate with them, and they refunded the price of a spare blade which I bought straight away.
customer_reviews.author: P.w

customer_reviews.title: Best Shaver!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a hairy man - he also suffers from sensitive skin. He says that this is hands down the BEST shaver he has ever used. It's quick and easy to use and he says its better than the £100+ shaver he had previously. I also like the fact that his stubble seems to grow back softer and he has less ingrown hairs - Win!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Hanley

customer_reviews.title: tried the rest. now the buy the best.
customer_reviews.text: highly impressive lightweight shaver. well thought out product design. works well. doesnt cut your balls either. smooth as. thanks phillips. warmest regards, charles. ps. should come with USB charger. highly disappointed it didn't. had to buy separately did have 5 stars during writing this however just remember about this. I was disappointed
customer_reviews.author: rumoclock

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting a bit more from a brand like Philips and the price. The packaging wasn't great, not what you expect from a premium brand, more like something knocked up in China. It needed charging which was annoying but ok, however, I soon discovered you can't use it while it's charging which seems stupid to me, it must be unplugged to use. It feels a bit flimsy, again I expect more for the price. On the plus side, it's very good at doing straight edges, it's essentially a small shaver. I'd look for alternatives, it's worth about half the price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Been using for a few years now and I have to say I absolutely love it. I have quite a thick beard and I haven't received a single cut from it. It does the job really well. My skin is really sensetive so have to use an aftershave balm afterwards, but other than that no problems what so ever. It shaves to about 1-2 days post shave and the process is smooth. I have recommended as a gift to many people and everyone seems to love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Yavor Vrachev

customer_reviews.title: Awful waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Biggest load of sh**e I've bought in a long time!! I've had it less than a day & wish I hadn't broken the box up - I would have sent it back. Won't touch my beard & won't shave my neck. It's cr*p in my opinion & a total waste of my money! Trimmed my beard with my old trimmer perfectly after trying it. Hope this review helps you to keep your money in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a razor or electric shaver due to the horrific shaving rash that occurs. This basically leaves me with a beard trimmer which guarantees a permanent stubble look. This device, however, is different. Mechanically it is the same as a beard trimmer, with two toothed blades, one of which has a lateral oscillation to cut the hair. The difference is the blades are much thinner than on a beard trimmer which gives a much closer shave. The result is a shave that looks almost, but not quite, as close as a razor. And with no rash. Essentially its the best compromise between closeness and irritability I've found to date.
customer_reviews.author: STM

customer_reviews.title: Shaving is always a pain no matter what you use
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize there are different types and this is the basic one. No real instructions the bits can go on up or downward. 8hour charge( basic model) is the green light ever going to turn red or go off if there were instructions I would know. One little drop or knock and the blade is rendered useless not a useable product in the real world only used 3 or 4 times and now it lives in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: By a hundred miles the best electric trimmer I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: By a hundred miles the best electric trimmer I've ever used. Would never trade it. I genuinely can't believe how close it gets- it's like a wet shave. Just nuts. Buy it. One thing to be aware of- it has a European plug. No idea why. You'll need an adapter. Battery lasts forever though... you won't be doing much charging.
customer_reviews.author: Alex J. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Be aware there are different versions of this Item.
customer_reviews.text: when I purchased this item it was on an offer. So I took the plunge. Although I am fairly happy with this item It does trim and shave (not as close as a razor) I do feel slightly cheated as the model on offer was an 8 hour charge for 45 minutes use and only a charge indicator on the adapter. There is a better one 4hrs charge for 60 minutes use, and charge indicator with battery status level on the handle. My fault I suppose for not checking but there was a time limit to order.
customer_reviews.author: Shortylong

customer_reviews.title: Great apart from the weak attachments
customer_reviews.text: The main item is good but the attachments are rubbish the clips that hold them on break off very easily leaving them to fall off whilst in use...resulting in bold patch in your beard! The replacement blades are very expensive almost worth buying a hole new unit instead of just one new blade ridiculous concept pure greed by Philips..I do like the main unit works well for close trimming no complaints with that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Gillette say they are the best a man can get for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the worst shaving product I have ever purchased. And yes, I have used those 10p orange razors that shred your face to pieces. I now get up an hour earlier than before, just so I can attempt to shave my stubble and make myself look half presentable. I don't have thick facial hair, but I must be doing something wrong as it still looks like the end of the day once I have finished. This morning, I even considered using a pair of scissors to get a closer shave. Waste of money and waste of time. Very disappointed. Wet shave is and always will be the fastest and closest shave. This is going in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Ok but...
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. But I find I have to do lots of strokes to complete the trim and it seems to take ages. Longer than my current more traditional trimmer. I bought an additional 1mm trim piece from Phillips for £8! I think Phillips charge reasonable initial prices but accessories are expensive. Like the sonicare toothbrush heads! Also it’s easy to switch it off by accident with the prominent on/off button. It’s nice in the hand tho and small enough for travelling
customer_reviews.author: pete d

customer_reviews.title: Painful to use. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This feels like its ripping the hair out! Ive only had it a few weeks so it doesnt need a new blade. It does go quite close but for me i have to go with the grain not against as against is too painful. To be honest ive used foil shavers before and had the same problem so it might just be me. I will continue to use but going with the grain of hair, as it is close enough for my intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: D.Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I found that this shaver was excellent for me as I struggled with finding a tough shaver that could remove my hair, smoothly. This blade is neatly compacted, with multi purpose functions; different blades for various parts of body. As a woman, I found that this blade more idealistic than range of selection that is sold in women selections. My brother brought this blade too and says it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shaw Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Quick trackable delivery with alert uodates even though I didn't request quick delivery. Free delivery at that! Well organised and packaged. Everything as stated in ad. I watched online videos about its use on YouTube - so the very tiny scripted unclear info leaflet wasn't of any issue. The videos are great. And I am using a zip bag that I already had to stow it in - so no need to buy a special bag for it. Oh, add very good and easy to use product!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Durden

customer_reviews.title: Six Shaves - New Blade
customer_reviews.text: I bought my OneBlade during the recent offer (21st May 2019). I've used it six times, and it gives a great shave without any cuts or irritation. The problem stems from the blade. Philips say that the blade lasts for four months. I've attached a photo of mine after two weeks. The green bar is the blade replacement indicator. According to the Philips website this can be on account of: High hair volume and density. If you've got a thick beard, this might not be your most cost efficient option.
customer_reviews.author: Brudenell

customer_reviews.title: Best shaver but it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I simply can’t overstate how good this is. I’m tried many shavers but this baby is the best for an even close shave. The battery life between charges is only beaten by the long life blades.....i’m only just at the point of needing to change the first blade.....i’ve lost track but its over a year and that is shaving once a week thick facial hair. The body hair guard is a belter after a very careful shave of the family jewels i realised not only does that give you a very close shave it’s very gentle and there is no danger of circumcising ones self 😂 totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C.

customer_reviews.title: The best electric shaver I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Like most the majority of black me my face is very sensitive and i must be careful of what I use to shave and how I shave. I took 2-3 months investigating different shaves, as I wanted one that would last but also gave me the best shave possible. I found this and I have to say it is amazing. If you shave correctly you get no bumps, it shaves close enough, but not to close and as such gives a great clean shave look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: Great for taking off a beard if you've missed shaving for a week, but I don't find it a good alternative to a wet shave with a razor. The height adjustment accessories are good, and it's great for eyebrows. My son also has one and uses it as his only way to shave, as he suffers from razor burn. I'd recommend it, but not as your only means of shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for stubble, but of you're looking for a smooth skin finish, it's not the tool
customer_reviews.text: Love the razor itself, it's very easy to get the lines you want, for shaping and contouring, but if it's a smooth shave you want, this isn't the right razor. My only other gripe about buying this is the presentation / packaging. It would have been nice to have a neat zip up pouch for it. Oh and although you do get an extra blade with it, replacement blades are not cheap. But I would imagine they do last quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Morris

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t shave the buzz 🐝 free a bees behind. Really disappointed ☹️ Ended up giving it to my son who also thought it was crap. You just can’t get a clean shave with this thing. Even my teenage daughter tried it out on her soft hairs on her leg and thought it was poor. I don’t know if the blades I received were duff? Anyway more junk sitting around the house now. Shame on you Philip’s I have other shavers from you and they are great but really this one is crap.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yiannakou

customer_reviews.title: A cross between a dry electric and wet shaver but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as the thought of being able to dry shave close without friction burns would be great. It is unfortunately not that handy, it takes longer with this than a quick wet shave with a decent bladed rasor. I also find it still encourages a rash that wet shaving does not. I do use it when travelling so I don't have a wet shave bag but still not a 100% replacment for a decent quality blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish! Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointing. Hardly cuts my beard hair at all. I tried it nice and slow (like in the demo video), but it was only cutting a few beard hairs, yet it left my skin sore. So I had sore skin but still had my beard. Not a suitable substitute for conventional shaving methods or a standard trimmer. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Needs a EU to UK adapter to be included for 5☆s
customer_reviews.text: Works incredibly well, I'd let my facial hair grow for a week (as I was off work anyway) to see how this coped and I was genuinely impressed that it left me clean shaven after 1 pass! I have only given 4 stars as it has a European plug (I live in England) so I had to hunt around for an adapter. These days not all bathrooms have a shaver socket (in fact I cannot remember the last place I lived that had one) so it would be nice if, when shipping to UK buyers they included an adapter so we can actually charge the shaver!
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Life changing Razor
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it is amazing and far outshone oy expectations. It is effortless to use with no cuts or irritation and if used with shaving foam cuts as close as my previous raver a Harrys which was a good razor. The only trouble with it is I might end up shaving my legs as I am so keen to have another shave, but my stubble won't grow quick enough. I never thought I would look forward to shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly as it is meant to
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly as it is meant to. It is well made and gives a reasonable shave with little effort. I tend to grow a beard, then when it starts to get annoying which is anything over half an inch in length it has to come off. This takes it off down to the skin in one pass with a second pass to get rid of the odd straggler. I would have given if five stars if the cost of replacement blades were not so high. They are about £10 to £12 each.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It's ok if you get it cheap enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my head while travelling and it wasn't suitable. It was ok for the first few shaves but the blades go dull extremely quickly and it takes a while to get a full head shave. On the face it's pretty good and doesn't go blunt as quickly but it doesn't like the hairs which lay flat against my neck. Plus the replacement heads are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Sensitive Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have always wet shave with a razor due to very sensitive skin so was dubious to try this. However i can honestly say that this DOES work with a little effort. I personally find it much easier to shave dry. Does it take longer, not sure as it depends on the hairs and what direction they grow in. You will not get a baby skin shave more like maybe a day after equivalent. 4 stars as I personally find if you don’t shave against the hair perfectly you find yourself going over and over until you get the direction.
customer_reviews.author: rrr

customer_reviews.title: A close shave but not too close
customer_reviews.text: Love this product it is easy to use and does not cut or irritate the skin (even in more sensitive areas), using the face blade will leave you with a 5 o'clock shadow and the body trimmer will leave a little more on the top. additional length attachments are provided for a more custom length. I have seen reviews complaining about the charger but it is for a bathroom socket and will only need a simple adapter to plug into the mains. It comes with a travel bag and does not take up much room in a weekend bag, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: The best Razor I have ever owned and I've owned many
customer_reviews.text: Am 50 years old and this is by far the best razor I have ever used - also the price its great value -I have spent over £300 on electric wet dry razors and this ONE gives a better shave, gets round all my neck and adams apple. It may not be perfect for everyone but I'll never buy a different razor ever. Had it for a few weeks now - still performing top notch and battery seems to last real well.
customer_reviews.author: J Cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Really like this one, took a few uses to get really used to it but couldnt be much simpler. Cancelled my razor subscription, you don't get as close a shave as a blade but better than other electrics I've used. Only wish it came with some longer trimmer lengths as personally they are too short for body hair length, 5mm the longest.
customer_reviews.author: James Staddon

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great little product. This comes in plain packaging as sold via Amazon. It comes complete with three combs along with a replacement head. Close enough shave for me as I have rather sensitive skin. Seems to hold charge well and lasts a good few shaves before needing a top up on juice. Recommend for a quick shave but no comparison to a traditional wet shave.
customer_reviews.author: Nath

customer_reviews.title: Sleek design, light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Shaver is quite sleek in design, wouldn’t take up much room in a wash bag. Comes with 2 blades (1 spare) and 3 length guards, easy to fit. Will need a plug adapter as it’s a 2 pin connector, holds charge well. I’ve used with guards and without any guard and usually I have sensitive skin but I’ve had no issues, easy to hold and has a fine trimming blade on the back for shape up. Really impressed and worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good stand-by
customer_reviews.text: Through lockdown this provided a large part of my beard care. The range of trimmers reduced the spread to my satisfaction and it is easy to use. Two minor issues that if addressed could make it better; a better storage arrangement and the regular requirement and cost of new blades, which seems to be barbering's eqivalent of printer ink.
customer_reviews.author: Dorset man

customer_reviews.title: No more razor burn
customer_reviews.text: I didnt know i needed this until i bought it. Sensitive skin, always got razor burn, so at best could only shave once every week or do a very light shave. havin used this only once so far, i think its great and can see myself reaching for this as deafult every couple of days. only gripes on thr design are, they could have made it USB charging, and the head should have been reversible to allow tighter under cutting of beard
customer_reviews.author: Keiser Soze

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews, however, for this shaver I must. I suffer from rashes when I use a normal electric shaver, so, I shave once a week. I saw this shaver and read the reviews and thought that for £30 ish, it was worth a go. It is brilliant, I have been using it everyday for a week now and no rash. It does not shave as close as a wet razor, but, used daily, it gives a really good shave, it takes a minute to shave and you will be surprised at the closeness of the shave and no skin irritation! it is a fantastic little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic alternative to blade razor
customer_reviews.text: Having a very sensitive skin, i was trying to find a good alternative to blade razor. none of the electric razor i tried so far (even the very expensive braun 9's) were satisfying. Or my skin gets irritated and red, or have of my face (especially neck) is still unsaved after 20min. This oneblade is however a very good alternative. It still irritates my skin somehow, and i also cut myself periodically, but overall i am extremely satisfied and strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed, my beard Was getting long in lockdown And this worked wonderfully it trimmed my beard in no time at all and I’m happy with the results. The trimmer came very well packaged and included The trimmer 2 blades a 2 pin charge And 3 different size guards. It’s easy to use and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike.t

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I'm at a point where i don't want to be clean shaven but want to look smart. The one blade is perfect for this - the 2mm attachment gives great results. the pub trimmer is also great and does't nip your balls or shaft like others do. The clean shave option is also really effective and better than my Braun series 7! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: The only stubble trimmer that works
customer_reviews.text: I've tried are around 6 different stubble trimmers over the past 12 years and this is the only one that works. You also don't have to force it into your face to trim your hair. The 3mm trimmer is the best, the bare blade for the side and bottom of your neck is brilliant. Baby soft skin, no rashes and no ingrown hairs! It also works great on body hair trimming / shaving. All round a great product, I'll have this for the rest of my life
customer_reviews.author: Paul Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: All round its a good shaver, but like all battery shavers, a huge reduction in power after a couple of minutes, which can lead to whiskers getting caught in the blades. (I need a shaver for work), As i have to shave a lot with sensitive skin, i wey shave in an evening and dry in a morning. Doesn't matter how much i spend, all shavers i have tried have never given me a pain free shave. Unfortunatly :( This PhilipsOneblade has given me the best shave so far in a morning. Its comfy to hold and use. I would recommend as i have spent over a £150 before for the same shave.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and perfect when cutting.
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders on my beard and head. So very happy with it. However i feel the blade may die much sooner then 4 months but this will be because of me using it to go bald. Luckily i have two blades so should be ok for now. I also have sensitive skin on my neck. This always gets hurt during a wet shave. Not with this. Happy happy days
customer_reviews.author: zain gaf

customer_reviews.title: Really convenient
customer_reviews.text: The only razor I ever need now - it is handy both for home and for travelling with as its really compact. Lasts well on its charge however won't work while it's charging so this needs to be kept in mind. Other than that a really brilliant product, far better than others I've purchased which were over double the price.
customer_reviews.author: N. M

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe the advertising with this cutting without pulling line but frankly its true. Not a single pull from beard to clean shaven. Its weak point for me is when trying to have a proper clean shave, it just doesn't do it evenly enough. However, i use it for keeping my beard trimmed and neat and it does this as well as all other body hair trimming effortlessly. Don't waste money like i did on more expensive hair clippers, they simply cannot compete.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I always wet shave but like most men will leave it a few days rather than shave every day. I have tried a electric shavers both expensive and both would GRAB hold of stubble and pull it out! Which we all know is excruciating:-). I have “hard” stubble but this razor flies through it not problem. It’s not a close shave but is great for everyday use. Works just like a hair trimmer but in a razor. Great idea good product
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This, by far, has been the best electric shaver I have ever purchased. As someone with sensitive skin, i have never found a shaver that doesn’t tug or leave a rash after. When I shave now I can’t even feel it shaving, its that smooth and no rash either! I would highly recommend this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: I have long looked for a razor that copes with fine hair, as most are aimed at blokes that can grow a beard at lunchtime - and this is the best electric I have found. It doesn’t shave as close as a wet razor, but it also hardly misses any hairs so it’s a quick and reliable every day razor, which is exactly what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for women too!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman who uses this. It's really good! Good for down there, doesn't leave an awful shaving stinging rash like razors do. If your slow and careful, use a mirror if you need to, pull out excess skin and use the attachments to get some practise it will be fine. Its rechargeable too so no need for loads of batteries!
customer_reviews.author: EmmaM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product on an almost daily basis for nearly two years. I have replaced the bladed at about the recommended intervals. The device has excellent battery life with a built in rechargeable battery. The trimmer is well designed, easy to hold and use and produces consistently good results. An excellent price too. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dilo

customer_reviews.title: Great electric razor - wet or dry the results are almost as good as a regular razor
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing shaver. At least as close as a rotary head shaver - but works like a regular razor. I have a tough beard and so far after 2 months the blade still appears as good as new. I've used it in the shower without any problems and have used the 3mm and 5mm guards for eyebrows and beard trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Green

customer_reviews.title: Useful Prior to Wet Shave
customer_reviews.text: Having suffered a few nicks from wet shaving, I sought an alternative. This product is good for those tricky areas under the chin and bottom lip. However, I wouldn’t regard it as giving a good enough shave on its own. I therefore use it prior to wet shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlock

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to Normal Shaving!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, This is the best and easiest shaving tool I have ever owned. It takes off the hair with ease and only takes me 2-3 minutes to fully shave. What's not to like about that XD I would highly recommend this to someone who hates the hassle of normal shaving :) plus the heads last 4 months if you shave twice I week - I don't so that is 8 months for me.... For one head XD
customer_reviews.author: Curtis-Ray Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great product great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Any one looking for a shaver/beard trimmer that’s exceptional vale for money easy to use look no further. The one blade is easy to hold Light weight and the precision edge of the blade coupled with the angle it is held at make it so easy to get clean edges for stubble or beard alike. The charge life is impressive I’ve used this every other day now for 2 weeks on 1 charge. I strongly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good apart from actual grading guards
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty good, small and works great if you want to leave a beard pretty long or very short. The grade 1 is probably a grade 1 but next is a grade 3 and that's a bit on the long side. Needs at least 1 in between guard in my opinion which I don't believe they offer
customer_reviews.author: M. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful razor
customer_reviews.text: After having left my old razor in a different country, I was indeed of a new one and though i would give this one ago. It doesn’t disappoint, cuts really close like a razor would with zero pulling and neck rash afterwards. The 4 razor attachments are great meaning you are able to get the correct length required. The whole thing make it effortless and then the blade does a great job at tidying and lining things up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. T. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant iv used Gillette fusion/ the new sensitive skin shaver a 3 rotary shaver and even a standard electric shaver and they all had the same problem the plucked and pulled hair! With this iv had it 2 months THE BEST SHAVER EVER!! It won’t cut you, it doesn’t pluck or pull hair, the blades last up to 3 months doing a twice weekly shave literally the best, my only very very very small problem with it is doesn’t have a level charging indicator just a light to say it’s charging that’s it, but out the box iv used it 2 months for once a week and it’s still going.
customer_reviews.author: crazyfoolric90

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used a fair few beard trimmers over the years and this one has been my favourite. It comes with multiple different lengths, a body option which makes it so you can't catch yourself while shaving, but also offers a close shave. Even when you shave against the grain without a head on it, it doesn't pull and is a very clean shave. The charge lasts a very long time, I have been using the razor for about a month now (approx 8 shaves), and I have only had to charge it once. I would recommend this product as it is very good value for money and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Howell

customer_reviews.title: First blade broke within 10 seconds, 2nd broke within a minute!
customer_reviews.text: First blade snapped off at the mounting point in 2 places within the first few seconds of use. The 2nd did the same. Its a good device when it works, really good, but quality control if junk and I can't get anyone at Amazon or Philips to send me new blades (as above, I like the device and want to keep it). Suggest looking for a knock-off brand - it can't be any worse...
customer_reviews.author: BobMiller

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, avoid 1 star - blade subscription and terrible product
customer_reviews.text: 1, -2 stars this is an attempt to get on the $$$ overpriced blade subscription plan 2, -2 stars which might be ok if the product worked. but its terrible, you have to go over each area 10 times. literally any other razer electric or manual does a far superior job.
customer_reviews.author: CmdrBeef

customer_reviews.title: Number 1 trimmer for me now
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to replace my normal shaver with blades as my skin usually gets irritated and sore after a shave. With this my skin feels super smooth with a close shave. They are also great for anywhere else in the body as they dont seem to cut the skin on certain areas, also it has a great way to check once the blade is recommended to change by looking at the shiny bitin the middle as the more times you use it the more it dissapeares.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant device and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have never grown a beard as it always got too itchy after 2 weeks to the point of wanting to rip off my face. I bought this shaver and gave it a go. It worked flawlessly and this device actually stopped the irritation. It cut perfectly and now I can grow a beard. I also use it to trim my beard regularly. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andcom

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I love Philips products, but this shaver is in my opinion all hype. I was hoping it would replace disposal razors, but it does not give a close shave at all. The product is also very cheaply made, not the quality I expected. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: So smooth!
customer_reviews.text: Was worried it wouldnt be as good as it said but was surprised how easy and good it was. Was easy to shave my face and body without any foam or cuts, got as close as possible to the skin without any damage or even a scratch. Was really surprised how good it was, highly recommend you get one, they are always on sale and this set is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to blade shaving
customer_reviews.text: It's an interesting product but not even close to blade shaving. It is design to shave only against the grain. If used in any other direction it doesn't cut much. Also it's most effective when cut at the base of the hair not using combs. Using it dry makes a lot of mess so I recommend to use it with shaving foam.
customer_reviews.author: Lucian

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this OneBlade shaver. Small, compact, light and easy to use. Other generic electric shavers I had previously used were irritating my skin, so I picked this up in a Black Friday sale - feels great to use and no irritation any more. Comes with an extra blade and a beard-trimmer. Not the closest shave, but does the job and is so quick and easy to use. Battery life also good.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely best shaver
customer_reviews.text: To this day this is still the best shaver I have ever purchased This is the closest you can get without a real blade and you would find it very difficult to see or feel the difference between them, with this also being much faster and no need to water/soap/shaving foam or anything altho you can also still use if you still wish too.
customer_reviews.author: sean malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Are they having a laugh?
customer_reviews.text: Even when brand new the blade "shaves" little closer than a conventional trimmer, making it somewhat pointless but to add insult, it does so more slowly and is harder to control. For trimming sideburns, a beard or goatee it is just feeble and I don't consider myself to have a particularly heavy beard. I find a conventional trimmer and electric razor produces a far better more controlled result in a much shorter time than using the Oneblade alone. I won't be buying any replacement blades.
customer_reviews.author: ALebbon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming the beard
customer_reviews.text: Use this regularly to keep my beard trimmed neatly. The clip on heads make it easy to pick a length that suits and when using without the attachments, the trimmer is ideal for lining out the beard around the neck and cheeks. I've done a couple of full shaves with this, it works well however it obviously doesn't shave as close as a proper razor.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, non standard chargers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an upgrade and have since lost the charger. I was dismayed to find out that the previous model's charging cable would not function with the newer model as the input has a different shape. This is of course my own issue, but it would be nice to see standard port designs so I don't have to buy yet another cable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure the razor is fine, but seller let themselves down 👇
customer_reviews.text: Product came used with hairs still in the box from the previous user.. Ergh! 🤮 And the charger was missing. Was in my house about 5 min before it was repacked and returned. Not as described.
customer_reviews.author: MWB

product_meta.description:
Philips OneBlade QP2520/30 Trimmer and Shaver Shaving & Trimming tips and tricks - Make sure that the blade is in full contact with the skin by placing it flat on the skin. For the best result, move the appliance against the grain. Make long strokes while pressing lightly. OneBlade is designed to cut hair, not skin. Use Oneblade without the combs to shave as close as 0.2mm. Put on the combs to trim to 1, 3 and 5mm. You can use the appliance dry or wet with gel or foam. You can even use the appliance in the shower. Comes with Amazon frustration-free-packaging; this product comes with a 2-pin shaver plug. Includes storage cap. The blades are designed for lasting performance. For optimal performance, you will only need to replace each blade every 4 months*. Replacement is easy and hassle free. Compatible blade packs: QP210/50, QP220/50, QP230/50. Blades are available via Amazon.co.uk. The OneBlade QP2520/30 is designed for facial use. Using OneBlade on your body? Search for OneBlade Face + Body (QP2630/30)! Go against the grain and shave off any length of hair easily on your face or body. *For best shaving experience based on two full shaves per week, actual results may vary.
